TYPE().details: Override this if you implement new type of authorizer.

_NAME().details: Convert to `string` which looks prettier on Etherscan viewer.

initialize(address).details: When used in proxy mode, `initialize` can be called by anyone      to claim the ownership.      This function can be called only once.

params.callResult: Transaction call status and return data.

postExecProcess((address,address,uint256.details: Perform actions after the transaction execution.

returns.authData: Return check status, error message and other data.

preExecProcess((address,address,uint256,.details: Perform actions before the transaction execution.

params._account: the account which the authorizer get role manager from.

params._caller: the caller which calls the authorizer.

params._paused: the paused status: true or false.

preExecCheck((address,address,uint256,ad.notice: Check if the transaction can be executed.

setPaused(bool).notice: Set the pause status. Authorizer just denies all when paused.

setPendingOwner(address).notice: The original owner calls `setPendingOwner(newOwner)` and the new         owner calls `acceptOwner()` to take the ownership.

setTag(bytes32).notice: Change the tag for the contract instance.

transferOwnership(address).notice: User should ensure the corrent owner address set, or the         ownership may be transferred to blackhole. It is recommended to         take a safer way with setPendingOwner() + acceptOwner().
